column4: Is anybody here using the fglrx drivers, they don't seem to support lucid.
use system -> Admin -> Hardware drivers
are you using it? Does it work with the 2.6.34 kernel?
press ALT+F2 and run:  nautilus -1
that closed my nautilus window, but I still cannot see files on the desktop
run it again
yep, nautilus draws the desktop, it crashed so it restarted
install the 64bit deb from the skype site and then run:  sudo apt-get -f install     and it will install the deps
I don't want to install the ia32 stuff.
you don't have choice if you want skype
right, I can use a windows boot.
its skype's fault
yeah, it's cool they make a package I suppose.
what about a VM? If I put 32bit linux on a memory stick, and then I wouldn't have to exit my current os.
possibly, as long as it can access your hardware for skype
mouse settings maybe
no options there for the touchpad.
what is the output of: lsb_release -sc     please
No LSB modules are available.
grep -i code /etc/lsb-release      what is output please?
http://askubuntu.com/questions/161420/disabling-one-finger-tap-to-click-but-keep-two-finger-tap-ubuntu-12-04
